div.l: But it were only Oswold the Reue
By cause he was of carpenters craft
A litel Ire is in his herte y laft
He gan to grucche and blamed it a lyte
So þe ik quod he ful wel I couthe þe quyte
With bleryng of a prowde mellers eye
Ȝif þᵗat me liste to speke of ribaudye
But ik am olde me list not pleye for age
Gras tyme is done · my fodder is forage
This white top writeth myn olde ȝerys
Myn herte is also mowled as myn heres
But ȝit I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyt is eủere lenger þe wers
Til it be roten in mullok or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
Til we be roten can we not be rype
We hoppen alwey while þe world wol pipe
For in oure wil þer stiketh eủere a nayle
To haue and hoor hede and a grene tayle
As hath a leek / for thought oure myght be goon
Oure wille desireth folye eủere in oon
For whan we may nouȝt done þan wol we speke
Ȝit in oure asshen olde is fyre y reke
Foure gledes haue we whiche I shal deuise
Auᵘauntyng lyyng anger couetise
Thise foure sparkles longen vn to elde
Oure olde lymes may wel ben vnwelde
But wille shal not faylen þᵗat is soth
And ȝit haue I alwey a coltes toth
As many a ȝere / as it is passed henne
Syn þᵗat my tappe of lyf bigan to renne
For sikerly whan I was born anoon
Deth drough þe tappe of lyf ⁊and leet it goon
And eủere sithen hath so the tappe yronne
Til þᵗat almost al empty is the tonne
The streme of lyf now droppeth on þe chymbe
The sely tonge may wel rynge and chymbe
Of wrecchednes þat passed is ful ȝore
With ode folk saue dotage is more
